channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-13545] Upgrade HSQLDB to 2.3.4
item.description:
Upgrade HSQLDB from 2.0.0 to 2.3.4.
Version 2.3.4 is fully multithreaded and supports high performance 2PL and MVCC (multiversion concurrency control) transaction control models.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

This message was automatically generated.

I did run locally all the tests that use HSQLDB and all of them work fine.
stevel@apache.org Can you take a look?

Given how often JAR updates break things, I'm delegating the upgrade review process to others: that way we share the responsibility

  1. Can you mark in the JIRA which hadoop versions this affects, the patch is targeting, etc.
  2. is this a test-only dependency, or one used in production code. IF so, which module(s)

Just posted a rebase patch.

Few comments about stevel@apache.org's comments:
1. HSQLDB is used in couple of classes: DBCountPageView, DataDrivenDBRecordReader, DBRecordReader. I did run all the tests that involve these classes and all of them pass successfully.
ajisakaa, ozawa Can you please take a look since from git looks like you guys who most recently looked at the DBTests.
2. This Jira is targeting hadoop 2.9.
3. YARN-3663 under YARN-2915 umbrella for Junit tests I need the new version of HSQLDB.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
Test not related and asflicense does not apply for this patch.

steve_l I don't see much evidence of production use in the codebase, it seems that dependencies are rather old and mostly tests. Things should be fine committing this.

ajisakaa thanks for the review. I checked the patch as well, it looks good to me and I believe giovanni.fumarola addressed your comments.

Are you ok to commit the patch? If you don't have time to commit it right away (and are ok with me doing it), I will commit this tomorrow morning,
since this is blocking YARN-3663.
+1, thanks giovanni.fumarola for the update and thanks curino for the review.
Thanks ajisakaa for reviewing and committing, and giovanni.fumarola for the patch.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #11565 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/11565/)
